column4: any ufw/iptables experts around... for some reason after running sudo ufw allow 5432 (for postgres), the port is still showing closed when i run nmap
three listings one says LISTEN, other two say ESTABLISHED
here is the ufw status as well: http://pastebin.com/YwamxaYm
Postgres isn't listening to external interfaces.
I mean postgres isn't configured to bind to any external IPs, only localhost.
is that something I can set in hba conf
i have      local all all trust in the pg_hba... but I think that only applies to permissions to connect, not bindings yes
ahh... thx.  didn't realize there was such a setting.
so my "listen_addresses" was commented out... default must be localhost or local subnet or something
thx again.  learn something everyday.  Now in netstat I see :::*    :)
and the port is open from the outside
